paper_abstract: Large-scale multimedia streaming over the Internet requires an enormous amount of server and network resources. Traditional client - server approaches allocate a dedicated stream from the server for each client request, which is expensive and doesn't scale well. By using end hosts' huge bandwidth and computational capacity, peer-to-peer technologies shed new light on media streaming applications' development. Yet, locating supplying peers and content delivery path maintenance are two major challenges in this area.
paper_title: Challenges and approaches in large-scale P2P media streaming
